comment: Teaches fast and has an accent, but she is very understanding and helpful.  She changed around a lot of things to accommodate for the students, for instance once instead of giving a big test on one day, we asked if it could be split the test into two days, and she did that, which made it a lot less stressful and easy to study for.
Very nice!
She is very considerate and compassionate. I had tough time in class and she was very understanding of my situation
She doesnt take her job serious. Skips materials and never really explains anything. Never replies to emails. If you have a hard time with math. DO NOT TAKE HER!

You are better off taking an online class or just avoiding this professor. She teaches straight from the software and skips a lot of stuff. When asked a question, she laughs and deflects the question. I sent emails through d2l, hawkes, and outlook and she never replies. She is a good person. Just not a good teacher. Avoid her class!!!!!!!

Be prepared to learn everything outside the classroom. Uses Hawkes Learning System, and you can learn everything you need to do well through the program. She offers a practice test. The real test is the exact same format but only about 20 or so problems. Attendance isn't mandatory.

For me, the majority of the learning in the class took place in the Hawkes program. The lectures were good if you had a specific question and the she was always helpful. Quite easy class if you put in the effort.
Good class.

This class is very straightforward. 4 exams, weekly homework and she provides a review for each test which is exactly like the test except with different numbers. Just pay attention, practice, and put the necessary effort and you will pass. She drops one test grade and you get to skip final if you have an A before it.

She makes pre cal easy, she extends due dates 4 hw & tests. Her exams look just like the questions on d hawkes program u gotta buy for d class.Do d homework on hawkes cuz her exams are usually 22 quests just like the hawkes, she only changes the numbers. I mean how hard is that? if all 4 exams average to an A u r exempt from the final.Got an A !

She is hard to understand, doesn't explain in detail, rushes thru the lectures. Then makes mistakes while attempting to teach the lesson. Third week into class the size went from 30 people to 8. Don't waste your time.

She is a good and helpful professor. The class is not easy and you have to study for a good grade. The professor Vasiljevic will give you a chance to make up for a good grade, but you have to do the makeup yourself. Definitely would recommend her.
She is a very nice lady and understands the real world application of what you are learning. Her test at times are difficult but if you put in a good amount of effort you will be fine.

Mrs. V is a good teacher. She teaches the necessary concepts. I am an adult learner that has not taken a math class in over 10 years and I was never great at math. My work schedule did not allow for a tutoring option. I give her complete credit. I have now become a resource for people taking precalc. I just wish she taught calc 1, 2 & 3.

She's a nice lady. Bases teaching and tests straight from the book. Book is often  easier to understand than her teaching. There are 3 tests including the final, she drops one. No quizzes. Only homework grades. The homework isn't graded by her and she doesn't come on test days, so there is no asking questions during tests. I don't recommended her.
Good use of time, did review before tests, and had time outside of class to help
She is very nice and knowlegeable. Provides a lot of review materials and guidance.
The worst possible teacher out there.  Always makes mistakes and the class had to correct her all the time. I do not recommend this terrible professor.

Incredibly hard to understand and doesn't offer any help. If you ask for help, she directs you to the on-campus tutoring service rather than helping you herself. In my class she made constant errors and I would not recommend her class to anyone.
I strongly recommend taking her class. You will learn a lot!

She is an excellent teacher. Her class is hard but she gives a lot of opportunities to the students to earn a good grade. She focuses on the real meaning of the math concepts and breaks the problems to a level anyone can do with a little effort.
Hard to understand at times constant errors, the class is literally taught out of the book, but her notes can still be confusing.

Overall, I recommend her class to others. She’s the real thing. In the end, you will understand the math. But take responsibility for your side of the bargain. Work hard, just like you should at anything else you do. Because, the point is never completing the class, but understanding the math so you can be successful. Right on?

Ms. Luma was very great at explaining the various mathematical concepts so that they were easy to understand. Although the book was not very good at explaining, Ms. Luma made is simpler grasp. I really enjoyed the class, especially since I had been out of school for many many years. I would strongly recommend her to other students!

She is a very good math teacher. Her classes were very helpful in understanding the material. Like in any other math class you have to do practice problems to prepare for tests. I enjoyed her class, my math skills improved and will defenitely take her for other math classes.
She is confused at teaching the Math class. She laughs when you ask her questions. many people turned to tutoring with no success. I do not recommend taking this teacher at all.

There was no easiness to the class. The professor was not helpgul at all. The information and notes were not clear and understandable. I had some interest in taking this class with results to improving my math skills. She did not teach the material well many people turned to other textbooks and tutoring.
Luma is one of the better math teachers I've had. The lectures are helpful and she's genuinely interested in the success of her students.

She is very nice but her class is hard.  For our first two tests we were allowed to use a calculator.  Starting with our third exam they were banned.  People who were doing great on her tests before suddenly began failing.  Her drop rate and fail rate are both very high.  While not the worst teacher, I would not recommend her for college algebra.
she is bad.
She is a good teacher. Some students at this school should not be there. You can tell by their spelling and gramar.
NOT TRUE ABOUT WHAT STUDENTS WORTE, SHE ASKED HER STUDENTS TO RATE HER PERFECTLY . SHE DOESN'T KNOW MATH.

She is the worst. Thanks god she already left.it took the class with another prof and I got an A, that mean she didn't know she was talking about.if  you ask her, she would lough. I know that that last few comments from some of the students that shed asked them to do so. NEVER EVER EVER TAKE A CLASS WITH A PERSON LIE HER. IT IS NOT WORTH STAYING.
I really enjoyed with Professor Luma Vasiljevic. She is really smart and interesting. Her class is very nice i really enjoyed that much .

She jumped around a bit during lecture which took some getting used to as well as her accent. Overall I would take her again. She did her best to answer questions and her tests were straightforward covering the material gone over in class. Note she does care about attendance but didn't count it when I took the class.

I have taken college math courses before, and I thought she did a good job.  We knew in advance what work was due, she went over questions that were asked, and always talked to students as fellow citizens.  Grading was fair, tests were over what we had studies.

She is a great professor and knows her material well. Ms.Vasiljevic explains well the material she is teaching, and emphasizes the main points. She tries to help everyone during and after class. She has a good personality and she is easy to get along with.
Swell class

Very willing to assist and help the students.  Made study guides and gave back test results for study guides.  Material was hard due to the text book but the teacher claified items in the classroom.  Enjoyable class.
Good Teacher. Do the homework and you will pass the class.
She is a pretty good teacher. She explained the material very well and prepared notes for the class.
Very nice lady. The class is hard but she provides notes and if you do the work you will succeed
Very nice lady

math is my best subject i went through my 12 years of schooling with nothing but A's. i come to her algebra class and the reviews were easy i did very well the first few weeks of class then she got lazy saying lets only meet once a week. she doesnt understand the material because when you have questions she says go to tutoring. dont take her!

She teaches Math 1111. It's College Algebra, very basic and simple to understand on your own. She thinks everyone can understand exactly what she says and it is not the case. She only knows one way of explaining things and to someone new to math this a terrible thing. Take someone else, she is nice but not the best teacher.

Not too far into the semester and everyone is pretty much lost. She tries to explain things in a way that might make sense to another math professor, but to a student who is looking at the material with fresh eyes, this class/teacher can be a bit frustrating
She is a very bad teacher,very unclear. to pass the class studying is a must, get help, study for test and quiz, very little homework..I got a B, ITS POSSIBLE TO GET AN A
Has no idea how to teach. I honestly learned more not going to class and finding out how to do the worksheets online. Shes very confusing, and is bad at explaining how to do things.
Not helpful at all. Laughs at you when you ask questions. That isnt what a teacher should do. Needs to learn how to teach. Confusing alot of times and wasnt that helpful.
